@zfybo The speech was in Washington...
@zfybo Actually, from Frankfurt and Washington
Draghi in Q&A: our forward guidance differs from others in that it is qualitative. Harder to communicate initially; easier to get out at end
Draghi in Q&A: we're moving towards a more active management of our balance sheet.
Draghi in Q&A: when a central bank reaches lower bound on interest rates, size and composition of balance sheet is only remaining tool.
Draghi in Q&A at Brookings: politics is not a constraint on our decision making... The ECB has been successful in shielding itself.
Draghi: Cannot see any way out of the crisis unless we create more confidence in the future potential of our economies
Draghi: For governments and European institutions that have fiscal space, it makes sense to use it
Draghi: To now call into question not just the letter, but also the spirit of the fiscal governance framework would be self-defeating
Draghi: We are ready to alter size and/or composition of unconventional interventions as required
Draghi: These measures also fulfil broader objective: they allow us to continue to steer policy while interest rates are at lower bound
Draghi: ECB launched measures to make stance more expansionary & add more stimulus. Most important is our package of credit easing measures
Draghi: As the banking sector is cleaned up, banks will have new capacity to lend, and our monetary policy will become even more effective
Draghi: Policies to repair the banking sector have to be accompanied by policies to develop capital markets
Draghi at Brookings Institution: Without reform, there can be no recovery. I am sceptical that reform is better achieved in good times.
Speech Mario Draghi: Recovery and Reform in the euro area http://t.co/Mj7usOIS2Q
MB Article 2: Detailed bottom-up measure of fiscal effort useful complement to the structural balance, but no panacea
MB Article 2: A change in the structural balance is an imperfect measure of governments’ fiscal effort
MB Article 1: Further reductions in labour market rigidities would accelerate adjustment and reduce structural unemployment
MB Article 1: EA unemployment increases during the crisis in part reflect earlier structural imbalances and rigidities
MB Box 3: While financial factors improved, geopolitical risks and uncertainty about reforms may have reduced confidence
MB Box 3: Lower confidence for industrial and retail sectors and consumers behind the slowdown in economic activity
MB Box 2: Natural gas price declines are due to oil price developments, modest demand and convergence in wholesale markets
MB Box 2: Natural gas prices contributed to euro area disinflation. Outlook remains moderate despite supply chain risks
MB Box 1: Given the complementarity of the first two TLTROs, the two operations need to be assessed together
MB Box 1: A total of EUR 82.6 billion was allotted to 255 bidders representing 738 credit institutions in the first TLTRO

Draghi: Now it is implementation time for reforms
Draghi: Despite all the measures already taken, the GC still stands ready to take additional measures.
Draghi: The potential universe of purchasable assets is 1 trillion
Draghi: No programme, no purchases.
Draghi: The recovery is weak, fragile and uneven
Draghi: There is no great bargain here, but we know our measures are much more effective if there are reforms
Draghi: Effects of the many measures we took since June will unfold over time
Draghi: A prolonged period of too low inflation is harmful and that's why the measures were taken.
Draghi: We decided to include GR and CY assets in the programme, but with extra risk measures
Draghi: We will not buy structured assets although we accept them as collateral
Draghi: Programme is oriented towards boosting lending to SMEs
Draghi: The Stability and Growth Pact should remain the anchor for confidence in sustainable public finances
Draghi: The legislation and implementation of structural reforms clearly need to gain momentum in several countries
Draghi: Monetary policy contributes to supporting economic activity. However other policy areas need to contribute decisively.
Draghi: The Governing Council is unanimous in its commitment to using additional unconventional instruments within its mandate, if necessary
Draghi: With the monetary accommodation already in place, they will underpin a firm anchoring of medium to long-term inflation expectations
Draghi: They will reinforce fact of significant and increasing differences in the monetary policy cycle between major advanced economies
Draghi: Our asset purchases should ease the monetary policy stance more broadly and strengthen our forward guidance
Draghi: They will enhance functioning of the transm. mechanism, facilitate credit provision and create positive spillovers to other markets
Draghi: The measures will support specific market segments that play a key role in the financing of the economy.
Draghi: The purchase programmes will last for at least 2 years. Together with the TLTROs, they will have a sizeable impact on balance sheet.
